programme.desc: The Impossible Dream: When Frasier is awakened night after night by a recurring dream, he becomes obsessed with discovering its true meaning.

programme.title: Frasier

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The New Friend: Frasier develops a friendship with Roz's new boyfriend, who then cheats them both.

programme.title: Frasier

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Grampa vs. Sexual Inadequacy: Homer and Grampa take to the road to sell Grampa's miracle passion potion, but old resentments resurface when they pass their old house.

programme.title: Secret Headquarters
programme.desc: (2022) Family comedy with Michael Peña. A young lad discovers that his slacker dad is a superhero. And before he's got used to the idea, he must foil a villain's plot to bring his dad down.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Karen and Jerry look for their dream holiday home on the Greek island of Corfu for their £80k budget. Can Danni Menzies find them the perfect place for all their family to enjoy?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kate and Rob replace their 1940s past-it prefab with a bespoke, modern, factory-built home using volumetric modular construction. But will it feel like the characterful home they dream of?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Maxine and Tegan host at their Greenhills Hotel in Tenby, Pembrokeshire, where they hope to make their guests feel part of the family. Will a seal safari impress?

programme.desc: Visit two of the week is to Tom's Three Cliffs Bay Holiday Park in Swansea. But with one couple determined to find fault, Tom has his work cut out to impress everyone.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers head to Conwy, where pro chef Dan and his partner Lucy host at The Tal-y-Cafn. Dan's cocky about his breakfast. So what could possibly go wrong?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ivan and Jacqui host the week's final visit at Cambrian House B&B in Powys. But a good start is quickly sunk by one guest playing a prank on another...

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: Kazal and Eleena are ditching Dubai and moving back home to Solihull to be close to extended family. Can they overcome building blunders to create the ultimate hosting hub? (Ep3/4)

programme.desc: Newbie Nia has a bout of homesickness but gets an opening on a £15m property. Can she turn contacts into deals? And boss Rick turns up the heat on Michael to make more sales. (Ep5/6)

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: (2014) World War II action with Brad Pitt. A tank commander leads his crew into the dark, bloody heart of Hitler's last stand. But there's a rookie on board the Fury. With Michael Peña.

programme.title: Shayda
programme.desc: (2023) Noora Nisari's poignant drama with Zar Amir Ebrahimi as an Australian-Iranian woman fighting to start afresh with her daughter after fleeing an abusive marriage in 1990s Melbourne.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard
programme.desc: (1958) Drama. Jack Hawkins stars as Police Inspector Gideon, who faces outrage and danger in his quest to bring London's criminals to justice. With Anna Massey, John Loder and Cyril Cusack.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: (1957) Classic western with Glenn Ford and Van Heflin. The capture of a murderous stagecoach robber propels an impoverished local rancher on a perilous journey. Directed by Delmer Daves.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1956) Historical drama. The Oscar-winning Ingrid Bergman stars as an amnesiac refugee who Yul Brynner tries to pass off as the daughter of the murdered Tsar of Russia, Nicholas II.

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: (1994) Winona Ryder and Susan Sarandon star in Gillian Armstrong's adaptation of Louisa May Alcott's classic Civil War novel about 19th-century girl power in New England.

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: (2004) Breezy body-swap romcom. Following a disastrous birthday party, teen Jenna wishes she was '30, flirty and thriving'. And boom, she's Jennifer Garner with a fancy flat and a cool job.

programme.title: Vesper
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi fantasy with new-comer Raffiella Chapman and Eddie Marsan. A resourceful teenager scavenges to survive in a mushy and mushroom-y post-apocalyptic world of have and have-nots.

programme.title: The Running Man
programme.desc: (1987) Classic 80s dystopian thriller, based on a Stephen King novel. Gadget-wielding murderers hunt an innocent man (Arnold Schwarzenegger) on a sick TV show.

programme.title: Misery
programme.desc: (1990) Thriller with Kathy Bates and James Caan. An obsessed fan rescues her favourite writer from a car crash, but then imprisons him... It's the hobbling that really curls the toes!

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: (1956) Western. Randolph Scott stars as a cavalry officer who's accused of cowardice when he can't prove why he wasn't present at the Little Big Horn massacre.

programme.title: Siege at Red River
programme.desc: (1954) Western. Van Johnson stars as a Confederate agent who steals a Gatling gun prototype from the Yankees and attempts to smuggle it south through enemy lines to his own side.

programme.title: Nothing But the Best
programme.desc: (1964) Classic British dark comedy with Alan Bates and Denholm Elliott. An ambitious estate agent's clerk hires a toff to teach him to be posh. Couldn't possibly lead to murder, could it?

programme.title: A Room with a View
programme.desc: (1985) Helena Bonham Carter stars in this Merchant/Ivory film as an innocent on holiday in Florence, where a meeting with Julian Sands leads to romance.

programme.title: Ad Astra
programme.desc: (2019) Visually stunning sci-fi starring Brad Pitt as a famously cool astronaut sent to the edges of the solar system to save Earth from deadly power surges. With Tommy Lee Jones.

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: (1972) A Mafia don's son struggles to become a legitimate businessman in Francis Ford Coppola's classic crime drama. Starring Al Pacino, Marlon Brando, James Caan and Robert Duvall.

programme.title: The Motorcycle Diaries
programme.desc: (2004) Gael Garcia Bernal stars in Walter Salles' film as a young Che Guevara whose journey through South America realises his radical ideas. In Spanish/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Rango
programme.desc: (2011) Animated Wild West comedy with Johnny Depp. A pet chameleon accidentally becomes the sheriff of small frontier town, Dirt. Can he defend it? Oh, and he's got a mate called Roadkill.

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy sequel starring Whoopi Goldberg and Lauryn Hill. Deloris - who's now made it big in Vegas - goes back undercover as a teacher to help a struggling school choir find its voice.

programme.title: Howards End
programme.desc: (1992) Anthony Hopkins, Helena Bonham Carter and Emma Thompson star in James Ivory's adaptation of EM Forster's novel about two families, love, treachery and revenge.

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: (2007) Action adventure. Shia LaBeouf gets caught up in a battle between two groups of violent shape-shifting robots, one of which - the Decepticons - is out to destroy humanity.

programme.title: The Godfather Part II
programme.desc: (1974) De Niro and Pacino star in Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-laden crime family drama - the greatest ever sequel? - as it explores Vito Corleone's early life and Michael's rise to power.

programme.title: The Father
programme.desc: (2020) Oscar-winning drama with Anthony Hopkins and Olivia Colman. A man living with dementia struggles to piece reality together as he fights to keep his independence in his beloved home.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: (2014) World War II action with Brad Pitt. A tank commander leads his crew into the dark, bloody heart of Hitler's last stand. But there's a rookie on board the Fury. With Michael Peña.

programme.title: Shayda
programme.desc: (2023) Noora Nisari's poignant drama with Zar Amir Ebrahimi as an Australian-Iranian woman fighting to start afresh with her daughter after fleeing an abusive marriage in 1990s Melbourne.

programme.desc: (2019) Visually stunning sci-fi starring Brad Pitt as a famously cool astronaut sent to the edges of the solar system to save Earth from deadly power surges. With Tommy Lee Jones.

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: (1972) A Mafia don's son struggles to become a legitimate businessman in Francis Ford Coppola's classic crime drama. Starring Al Pacino, Marlon Brando, James Caan and Robert Duvall.

programme.title: The Motorcycle Diaries
programme.desc: (2004) Gael Garcia Bernal stars in Walter Salles' film as a young Che Guevara whose journey through South America realises his radical ideas. In Spanish/subs.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Rango

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy sequel starring Whoopi Goldberg and Lauryn Hill. Deloris - who's now made it big in Vegas - goes back undercover as a teacher to help a struggling school choir find its voice.

programme.title: Howards End
programme.desc: (1992) Anthony Hopkins, Helena Bonham Carter and Emma Thompson star in James Ivory's adaptation of EM Forster's novel about two families, love, treachery and revenge.

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: (2007) Action adventure. Shia LaBeouf gets caught up in a battle between two groups of violent shape-shifting robots, one of which - the Decepticons - is out to destroy humanity.

programme.title: The Godfather Part II
programme.desc: (1974) De Niro and Pacino star in Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-laden crime family drama - the greatest ever sequel? - as it explores Vito Corleone's early life and Michael's rise to power.

programme.title: Ainsley's National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by chefs Briony May Williams and Gaz Oakley at Tyntesfield in Somerset to see who can create and cook the Dish of the Day this time. Ainsley collects fresh chives from the estate's kitchen garden to make potato and chive scones with eggs, bacon and blistered tomatoes, Briony uses wood-fired ovens to knock up a crispy kale and lemon verbena pesto filo tart, and Gaz creates loaded courgettes, shiitake and walnut mince with a garlic tahini and nasturtiums

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton returns with the game show in which contestants compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes. Accountant John, primary school teacher Jess and care home assistant Paris try to win a potential jackpot of £50,000

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson presents from Bosworth Hall in Market Bosworth in Leicestershire, but will sellers accept the dealers' cash for their antiques or take their chances at auction? Mark Stevens reveals that all that glitters may not be gold, there's a big painting, a big cash offer, and a big surprise no for Stewart Hofgartner, and will John regret turning down over 2500 pounds in cash from Tim Hogarth for his pocket watches?

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as married couple Lalaine and Steven, siblings Farah and Ibby, and flatmates Tom and Tom use their powers of deduction to try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Nick from Bath, Bev from Borehamwood, Neil originally from Leeds and Eleanor from Cardiff join forces in the hope that their four brains can beat one

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: There is confusion, blame, and sadness for the village as the hospital deals with the fallout from the limo crash

programme.title: Scotland Tonight: Living with Severe Allergies
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Shortland Street: STV Player Presents
programme.desc: Drama set in a New Zealand accident and emergency ward. Registrars Cleo and Poppy arrive for their first day, Emmett locks horns with new nurse Mana, and Madonna hides her pregnancy

programme.title: Shortland Street: STV Player Presents
programme.desc: Long-running hospital drama set in a New Zealand accident and emergency ward, following the complicated personal and professional lives of its staff and their families and friends

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Forced Adoption: Britain's Silent Scandal - Tonight
programme.desc: In the four decades after the Second World War, more than 200,000 women were forced to give up their babies for adoption through practices run by church and state. Decades later, many are still traumatised and unable to reconnect with the children they never wanted to give up. Sarah Corker meets those campaigning for a formal apology from the UK government

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host welcomes another batch of celebrity guests to his green room, including star of stage and screen Brian Cox, Mad Men actress Christina Hendricks, Dancing on Ice judge Oti Mabuse and Strictly champion Chris McCausland. Plus, music by Snow Patrol

programme.title: Emergency Nurses: A&E Stories
programme.desc: Emergency nurses Jess, Hayley and Connor treat two bizarre injuries, Charlie and Gerry race to stabilise a RTC victim, and Toni treats a teen after a stunt.

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Contestants get the chance to win the biggest cash prize in British TV history with a limitless jackpot. First up are Joe and sister-in-law Jo, who have been prepping by going round the supermarket sizing things up with a tape measure, followed by Steve and son-in-law Jordan, who hope their approach will help propel them into the truly life-changing sums of money on the ladder

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his team of antiques dealers are at Newark Showground in Nottinghamshire where Simon Schneider is literally throwing money around and a seller tells the story of the valuable silver tankard they've brought with them that was dug up by Jixxy the cat. Mark Stevens has to phone a friend when faced with a table full of Royal Albert ceramics

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Adil Ray, with father and son Greg and Dean from Manchester, Bolton vicar Tony and his wife Doreen, and sisters Saira and Farrah from Reading taking part. They work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: The Chase

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Villagers grieve, the police have questions, and a relationship breaks down

programme.title: Live UEFA Women's Nations League
programme.desc: Portugal v England (Kick-off 7.45pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' opening Group A3 match, held at Estadio Municipal de Portimao. England are unbeaten in their last three meetings with Portugal, drawing one and winning two, and both teams will be determined to get off to a winning start in a strong group also containing Belgium and world champions Spain. With analysis from Ian Wright and Karen Carney, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: Olivia confronts the boys with their worst nightmare: will they hand over their phones to their girlfriends?

programme.title: Inside China: The Battle for Tibet
programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lama's successor and to Tibet's future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinping's rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host as 10 amateur designers go head to head in a competition to win a coveted dream job as a junior fashion designer for high street giant M&S. Over six episodes, the competitors will be tested on their design, problem-solving, commerciality and collaboration skills and judged by a panel of senior leaders at the company alongside a rotation of celebrity guests and designers. In their first challenge, the contestants are tasked with creating womenswear clothing under the watchful eye of guest judge Mel B

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Brighton for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The comedian's adventures take her to the Greek island of Corfu, where she buys a huge block of butter, gets nostalgic over nutmeg, visits a restaurant that's been run by the same family for 100 years and learns how to make pastitsada, a beef-based pasta dish. Then it's back to the yacht to make spicy lamb chops with saffron rice and a yoghurt and cucumber salad

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Celebrating the great British countryside, with Alan chatting to celebrity guests and experts sharing tips on how to make the most of the nation's outdoor spaces

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Ben and Georgie Ainslie into his kitchen to sample some recipes from Cyrus Todiwala and Jose Pizarro. Merlin Griffiths is at the bar crafting cocktails

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Scotland (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match from the third round of fixtures at Allianz Stadium, Twickenham. The visitors will be looking to extend their winning streak against their old rivals to five matches and retain the Calcutta Cup. Last year's match saw Duhan van der Merwe become the first Scottish player to score a hat-trick in this fixture as Scotland triumphed 30-21, and that was on the back of another dazzling solo performance in 2023 when he scored two tries at this venue, including one of the most memorable in the history of this illustrious fixture. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Johnnie Beattie and Ugo Monye, pitchside inserts from Topsy Ojo and Jim Hamilton, and commentary by Nick Mullins, Scott Hastings and Ben Kay

programme.title: The Murder of Bianca Devins: Social Media Murders

programme.title: English Football League Highlights

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special

programme.title: Ainsley's National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley is joined by chefs Briony May Williams and Gaz Oakley at Tyntesfield in Somerset to see who can create and cook the Dish of the Day this time. Ainsley collects fresh chives from the estate's kitchen garden to make potato and chive scones with eggs, bacon and blistered tomatoes, Briony uses wood-fired ovens to knock up a crispy kale and lemon verbena pesto filo tart, and Gaz creates loaded courgettes, shiitake and walnut mince with a garlic tahini and nasturtiums

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The comedian's adventures take her to the Greek island of Corfu, where she buys a huge block of butter, gets nostalgic over nutmeg, visits a restaurant that's been run by the same family for 100 years and learns how to make pastitsada, a beef-based pasta dish. Then it's back to the yacht to make spicy lamb chops with saffron rice and a yoghurt and cucumber salad

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Scotland (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match from the third round of fixtures at Allianz Stadium, Twickenham. The visitors will be looking to extend their winning streak against their old rivals to five matches and retain the Calcutta Cup. Last year's match saw Duhan van der Merwe become the first Scottish player to score a hat-trick in this fixture as Scotland triumphed 30-21, and that was on the back of another dazzling solo performance in 2023 when he scored two tries at this venue, including one of the most memorable in the history of this illustrious fixture.
